sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of natural disaster occurring in a region
message_1: What is the probability of a flood occurring in a particular city in the next 10 years if historical data shows that floods have a probability of 0.05 per year in this city?
message_2:
To calculate the probability of a flood occurring in the next 10 years, we can use the complementary probability method. This means we will first calculate the probability of no floods occurring in the next 10 years and then subtract that from 1.

The probability of no flood occurring in a single year is 1 - 0.05 = 0.95.

For 10 years, the probability of no floods occurring in all 10 years is (0.95)^10.

(0.95)^10 ≈ 0.5987

Now, we will find the complementary probability, which is the probability of at least one flood occurring in the next 10 years.

1 - 0.5987 ≈ 0.4013

So, the probability of a flood occurring in the next 10 years is approximately 0.4013 or 40.13%.
